product_name: COSRXLow pH Niacinamide Micellar Cleansing Water
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsSustainable PackagingThis COSRX Low pH Niacinamide Micellar Cleansing Water is suitable for sensitive skin with Niacinamide that gently removes makeup, and impurities and controls excessive sebum, helping sensitive skin turn into healthy skin.
details: DetailsBenefitsLow pH cleanser suitable for sensitive skinCleanses and controls excessive sebumGently removes makeupSoothes and hydrates skinKey IngredientsNiacinamide, Zinc PCAAllantoinHyaluronic AcidPanthenolItem 2621868How To UsePour on to a cotton pad and gently wipe all over the skin until all makeup and impurities have been removed. *For long wear or heavy makeup, allow the cotton pad to sit on the area for about 10 seconds. (No need to rinse but depending on personal cleansing habits, you may rinse with warm water or use a secondary cleanser if needed.)IngredientsWater, Dipropylene Glycol, Polyglyceryl-4 Caprate, Panthenol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Allantoin, Niacinamide(1,000ppm), Zinc Pca, Madecassoside, Propanediol, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, 1,2-hexanediol, Sodium Citrate, Citric Acid, Disodium EDTA.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Pour on to a cotton pad and gently wipe all over the skin until all makeup and impurities have been removed. *For long wear or heavy makeup, allow the cotton pad to sit on the area for about 10 seconds. (No need to rinse but depending on personal cleansing habits, you may rinse with warm water or use a secondary cleanser if needed.)

reviews.headline: Best Micellar Water!!
reviews.comments: absolutely love this micellar water it removes makeup so easy and leaves your face feeling so soft and smooth. I highly recommend

reviews.headline: All in 1 product
reviews.comments: Removed makeup perfectly and keeps the skin hydrated that sometimes i just this to remove everything and go to bed. Worth it.

reviews.headline: never want to be without this!
reviews.comments: I love this stuff. I've always had trouble doing my skincare routine consistently, especially when I'm running low on time and/or energy. I'm almost finished with the bottle and I've washed my face 1-2x a day almost every day for the last couple months which is amazing for me. It feels gentle and non-drying and I feel like I've seen a mild improvement in my skin since using it. I also struggle with skin picking especially while trying to do skincare (help), and this is a life-saver since I can clean my face really quick with a cotton round and add moisturizer and then get the heck away from the mirror, bless

reviews.headline: Stings my eyes
reviews.comments: I'll stick to simple Micellar water

reviews.headline: It's okay
reviews.comments: Didnt make my skin burny like Garnier does. And it didnt break me out, my skin actually looked nice when i started using it! But its not great at removing makeup which is the whole point of it for me.

reviews.headline: I will not buy it again
reviews.comments: Its not a bad micellar water but i wont buy it again, it burns my eyes as h*ll, like its impossible to take eye make up with it. So far best for me is Bioderma for sensitive skin.

faceoff_positive.comments: Ok, so I have been reading all about the two step cleansing and I have combination skin and could not find anything in the CODRX lines that I could use as a first cleanser. So I bought some Burt's Bees cleansing oil which I found very heavy and felt like I was just putting oil all over my face. It was hard to rinse and was not good for my face. I gave the BB away to a friend with dry skin. So I was stuck with the idea I should be doing a double cleanse but could not find a product geared to combination skin that felt like it cleaned. Then the announcement of this! Game changer! I have only used for about a week but I love that it will remove eye makeup and it feels like a toner and not an oily mess on my face. My face feels clean after the first step but I still used the good morning cleanser after. Thanks for making my first step cleanser come true! Also came well wrapped and packaged and the dispenser is not quick to pour so you do not waste product. It is a large bottle. Makes me happy! There is no Place to leave a photo or I would have. You link lead me to this.
faceoff_positive.headline: LOVE THIS 1st STEP CLEANER

faceoff_negative.comments: I think I like the Cosrx pads (poreless, green hero, etc), which I use like a cleanser in the mornings, more but the micellar water is a better value. I like the lack of smell. It has little soapy bubbles, which I don't like but which hasn't irritated my skin. I'm using disposable cotton things that were included by cosrx - they also sell them. I don't like those but I'm waiting for some stronger reusable/washable pads from purito so the experience might get better with those. I like the idea of being more environmentally friendly, so I might keep using the micellar water at home and the pads (like the poreless pads) for travel or for when I need something extra. Also, Cosrx is out of the pads I want a lot. Overall I don't love love this new product but I do think it' good.
faceoff_negative.headline: Seems good

rollup.name: Low pH Niacinamide Micellar Cleansing Water
